headline: Florentine Cookies
description: A creamy milk chocolate filling turns these oat-packed florentines into the ultimate sandwich cookie.
name: Florentine Cookies
recipeIngredient: 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips (such as Nestle® Toll House®)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line 2 cookie sheets with aluminum foil.

Melt butter in a large saucepan. Remove from heat and mix in oats, sugar, flour, corn syrup, milk, vanilla, and salt until well combined. Drop by level teaspoonfuls 3 inches apart onto the prepared cookie sheets. Spread cookies out thin with a rubber spatula.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 5 to 7 minutes. Cool on the cookie sheets.

Meanwhile, place chocolate chips in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted and smooth, about 5 minutes.
Peel foil from cookies. Spread melted chocolate on 1/2 of the cookies. Top with the remaining cookies.

review.reviewBody: I love this version of Florentines. I've made these a few times already and about to mix up another batch right meow. I've snacked on them just alone as a wafer but this time I have chocolate chips to melt and make them that way! Yum!
Super easy recipe! They came out crispy and wonderful
Love the cookies but they are very difficult to get off the aluminum foil. I'll try parchement paper next time.

What a fun cookie to make! I followed the recipe as written. I did have to add about a minute or 2 to get my cookies golden brown. They cooked best on the foil vs. a baking mat. Super thin and yummy tasting cookies.

Theses were tasty, crispy and easy to make. I scaled the recipe in half and got 5 very large cookies. I used milk chocolate chips, personal preference. I also baked them for 9 minutes and they were barely starting to brown. Next time I will make them smaller. Thank you for the recipe.
